isis.stitle: 8 SPEED, 9 SPEED, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON SERIES - REMOVE - AUXILIARY SECTION (9-SPEED AND RT-8608L MODELS)

step1.para: For ease of disassembly, mount the auxiliary section upright in a vise. Remove the bolts, range cylinder cover and gasket ( Figure 78).

figure.caption: Figure 78. Remove Bolts, Range Cylinder Cover and Gasket

step1.para: Remove the nut from the end of the yoke bar ( Figure 79).

figure.caption: Figure 79. Remove Nut From End of Yoke Bar

step1.para: Cut the lockwire and remove the two yoke lockscrews ( Figure 80).
Pull the yoke bar from the cylinder housing bore ( Figure 81).

figure.caption: Figure 81. Pull Yoke Bar From Cylinder Housing Bore

step1.para: Remove the range yoke from the sliding clutch of the synchronizer assembly ( Figure 82).

figure.caption: Figure 82. Remove Range Yoke From Sliding Clutch of Synchronizer Assembly

step1.para: Remove the range piston from the cylinder bore ( Figure 83). If necessary, remove the O-rings from the piston I.D. and O.D. ( inset, Figure 83).

figure.caption: Figure 83. Remove Range Piston and O-Rings

step1.para: Remove the bolts, range cylinder housing, and gasket ( Figure 84). If necessary, remove the small O-ring from the groove in the housing bore ( inset, Figure 84).

figure.caption: Figure 84. Remove Bolts, Range Cylinder Housing, Gasket and Small O-Ring

step1.para: Remove the bolts and both countershaft rear bearing covers and gaskets ( Figure 85).

figure.caption: Figure 85. Remove Bolts, Countershaft Rear Bearing Covers, and Gaskets

step1.para: Remove the snap ring from the groove at rear of each countershaft ( Figure 86).

figure.caption: Figure 86. Remove Snap Ring From Groove at Countershaft Rear

step1.para: Use a soft bar and maul to drive the countershafts forward and from the rear bearings ( Figure 87).

figure.caption: Figure 87. Drive Countershafts Forward and From Rear Bearings

step1.para: Remove the bearings from the bores in the auxiliary plate by tapping lightly and evenly to the rear with a soft bar ( Figure 88).

figure.caption: Figure 88. Remove Bearings From Bores in Auxiliary Plate

step1.para: If necessary, secure the assembly in a vise and remove the bearing inner race from the front of the countershaft with jaw pullers ( Figure 89).

note.para: The vise used should be equipped with brass jaws or wood blocks to prevent damage to the countershaft.

svcsubproc.title: Synchronizer Assembly
svcsubproc.para: Pull the synchronizer assembly from the splines of the output shaft ( Figure 90).

figure.caption: Figure 90. Pull Synchronizer Assembly From Splines of Output Shaft

svcsubproc.title: Output Shaft and Rear Bearing Assemblies
svcsubproc.para: Use a soft bar and maul to drive the output shaft forward and through the rear bearing assembly ( Figure 91).

figure.caption: Figure 91. Drive Output Shaft Forward and Through Rear Bearing Assembly
